title: Suspect ID’d in Burlington City homicide
content:
BURLINGTON CITY – The gunman who murdered a 24-year-old Burlington City man outside the victim’s home remains on the loose, authorities said Sunday.
Byron Turner was shot in the head on the 100 block of East Federal Street shortly before 7 p.m. Saturday and died a few hours later at Cooper University Hospital in Camden, police said.
A manhunt for the killer initially concentrated on the city’s New Yorkshire neighborhood, but authorities on Sunday made a widespread appeal to the public to help them find the suspect, 26-year-old Samuel James.
James’ last known address was on Route 130 North in Burlington Township, but authorities said he sometimes resides in Burlington City and Camden. The Burlington County Prosecutor’s Office announced Sunday that James has been charged with murder and weapons offenses.
During the gunfire, a 5-year-old girl in the area was injured while retreating but was not shot, police said. The girl was treated at Lourdes Medical Center in Willingboro and later released.
Authorities described James as black and about 6 feet tall, weighing about 140 pounds.
Anyone with information that could help detectives apprehend James is urged to call the Burlington City Police Department at (609) 386-0262, send a message to the department through its Facebook page, or call Burlington County Central Communications at (609) 267-8300.
